Differentiate between ionic, covalent, a.yourAnswer: Ionic bonds involve the complete transfer of electrons from one atom to another, resulting in the formation of ions (charged particles). Covalent bonds involve the sharing of electron pairs between atoms. Polar covalent bonds are a type of covalent bond where electrons are shared unequally between atoms, resulting in regions of partial positive and negative charges.

Contrast acids and bases in terms of pH.yourAnswer: Acids have a pH below 7, donate protons (H+ ions), taste sour, and turn litmus paper red. Bases have a pH above 7, accept protons, taste bitter, and turn litmus paper blue. Buffers help maintain pH stability by resisting changes in acidity or basicity through absorbing excess H+ or OH- ions.
